intro: Palhinhaea curvata, commonly known as the curved spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
